description: Adds a nice background image to inbox.google.com

user.about: My biggest project atm is the YouTube player enhancements script, which I'm actually pretty proud of. So please try it out, you won't be disappointed ...and if you are, I'd love to hear why ^^ Also, have a look into the .css file. In there you'll find - informations about versions - the status of new features - an option to disable/enable certain features of the script (just remove a '/' of a '*/' header or put it back) I might also have got other projects uploaded. About me I'm an 19 year old Uni student in the area of computer science. Also, I like pretty looking things (pretty in terms of minimalistic that is) Feedback is always appreciated.

additional_info:
might break anytime, I botched it and it works for now.
But google websites are really hard to work with (even the div class names change everytime)

In case it breaks in the future: sorry, I probably won't fix it... :(

One known bug: If there's just a few emails, the image will get cropped off. I added a workaround that extends the image to the bottom of the screen - this might look bad in some cases. In the second screenshot you can barely see where the image gets copied, it starts between "Spam" and "Kontakte".
